verses.textEn: Paul, an Apostle of Jesus Christ through the will of God, to all the saints who are at Ephesus and to the faithful in Christ Jesus.
verses.textLa: Paulus Apostolus Iesu Christi per voluntatem Dei, omnibus sanctis, qui sunt Ephesi, et fidelibus in Christo Iesu.

verses.textEn: Grace and peace to you from God the Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.textLa: Gratia vobis, et pax a Deo Patre nostro, et Domino Iesu Christo.

verses.textEn: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has blessed us with every spiritual blessing in the heavens, in Christ,
verses.textLa: Benedictus Deus et Pater Domini nostri Iesu Christi, qui benedixit nos in omni benedictione spirituali in cælestibus in Christo,
verses.notes: The word for heaven here is plural. This can be translated as heavenly places, and it reflects the symbolic relationship between the heavens (the sky, the stars, etc.) and Heaven itself.

verses.textEn: just as he chose us in him before the foundation of the world, so that we would be holy and immaculate in his sight, in charity.
verses.textLa: sicut elegit nos in ipso ante mundi constitutionem, ut essemus sancti et immaculati in conspectu eius in charitate.

verses.textEn: He has predestined us to adoption as sons, through Jesus Christ, in himself, according to the purpose of his will,
verses.textLa: Qui prædestinavit nos in adoptionem filiorum per Iesum Christum in ipsum: secundum propositum voluntatis suæ,

verses.textEn: for the praise of the glory of his grace, with which he has gifted us in his beloved Son.
verses.textLa: in laudem gloriæ gratiæ suæ, in qua gratificavit nos in dilecto Filio suo.

verses.textEn: In him, we have redemption through his blood: the remission of sins in accord with the riches of his grace,
verses.textLa: In quo habemus redemptionem per sanguinem eius, remissionem peccatorum secundum divitias gratiæ eius,

verses.textEn: which is superabundant in us, with all wisdom and prudence.
verses.textLa: quæ superabundavit in nobis in omni sapientia, et prudentia:
verses.notes: Prudence is the practical application of wisdom.

verses.textEn: So does he make known to us the mystery of his will, which he has set forth in Christ, in a manner well-pleasing to him,
verses.textLa: ut notum faceret nobis sacramentum voluntatis suæ, secundum beneplacitum eius, quod proposuit in eo,

verses.textEn: in the dispensation of the fullness of time, so as to renew in Christ everything that exists through him in heaven and on earth.
verses.textLa: in dispensatione plenitudinis temporum, instaurare omnia in Christo, quæ in cælis, et quæ in terra sunt, in ipso:

verses.textEn: In him, we too are called to our portion, having been predestined in accord with the plan of the One who accomplishes all things by the counsel of his will.
verses.textLa: In quo etiam et nos sorte vocati sumus prædestinati secundum propositum eius, qui operatur omnia secundum consilium voluntatis suæ:

verses.textEn: So may we be, to the praise of his glory, we who have hoped beforehand in Christ.
verses.textLa: ut simus in laudem gloriæ eius nos, qui ante speravimus in Christo:

verses.textEn: In him, you also, after you heard and believed the Word of truth, which is the Gospel of your salvation, were sealed with the Holy Spirit of the Promise.
verses.textLa: In quo et vos, cum audissetis verbum veritatis, (Evangelium salutis vestræ) in quo et credentes signati estis Spiritu promissionis Sancto,

verses.textEn: He is the pledge of our inheritance, unto the acquisition of redemption, to the praise of his glory.
verses.textLa: qui est pignus hereditatis nostræ, in redemptionem acquisitionis, in laudem gloriæ ipsius.

verses.textEn: Because of this, and hearing of your faith that is in the Lord Jesus, and of your love toward all the saints,
verses.textLa: Propterea et ego audiens fidem vestram, quæ est in Domino Iesu, et dilectionem in omnes sanctos,

verses.textEn: I have not ceased giving thanks for you, calling you to mind in my prayers,
verses.textLa: non cesso gratias agens pro vobis, memoriam vestri faciens in orationibus meis:

verses.textEn: so that the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of glory, may give a spirit of wisdom and of revelation to you, in knowledge of him.
verses.textLa: ut Deus, Domini nostri Iesu Christi, Pater gloriæ, det vobis spiritum sapientiæ et revelationis, in agnitione eius:

verses.textEn: May the eyes of your heart be illuminated, so that you may know what is the hope of his calling, and the wealth of the glory of his inheritance with the saints,
verses.textLa: illuminatos oculos cordis vestri, ut sciatis quæ sit spes vocationis eius, et quæ divitiæ gloriæ hereditatis eius in sanctis,

verses.textEn: and the preeminent magnitude of his virtue toward us, toward we who believe in accord with the work of his powerful virtue,
verses.textLa: et quæ sit supereminens magnitudo virtutis eius in nos, qui credimus secundum operationem potentiæ virtutis eius,

verses.textEn: which he wrought in Christ, raising him from the dead and establishing him at his right hand in the heavens,
verses.textLa: quam operatus est in Christo, suscitans illum a mortuis, et constituens ad dexteram suam in cælestibus:

verses.textEn: above every principality and power and virtue and dominion, and above every name that is given, not only in this age, but even in the future age.
verses.textLa: supra omnem principatum et potestatem, et virtutem, et dominationem, et omne nomen, quod nominatur non solum in hoc sæculo, sed etiam in futuro.

verses.textEn: And he has subjected all things under his feet, and he has made him the head over the entire Church,
verses.textLa: Et omnia subiecit sub pedibus eius: et ipsum dedit caput supra omnem Ecclesiam,

verses.textEn: which is his body and which is the fullness of him who accomplishes everything in everyone.
verses.textLa: quæ est corpus ipsius, et plenitudo eius, qui omnia in omnibus adimpletur.

verses.textEn: And you were once dead in your sins and offenses,
verses.textLa: Et vos, cum essetis mortui delictis, et peccatis vestris,

verses.textEn: in which you walked in times past, according to the age of this world, according to the prince of the power of this sky, the spirit who now works in the sons of distrust.
verses.textLa: in quibus aliquando ambulastis secundum sæculum mundi huius, secundum principem potestatis aeris huius, spiritus, qui nunc operatur in filios diffidentiæ,
verses.notes: The word ‘aeris’ can refer to sky or atmosphere or to the elements of this world (air, fire, earth, water). The prince referred to is the devil, a spirit who works in those who reject faith and trust in God.

verses.textEn: And we too were all conversant in these things, in times past, by the desires of our flesh, acting according to the will of the flesh and according to our own thoughts. And so we were, by nature, sons of wrath, even like the others.
verses.textLa: in quibus et nos omnes aliquando conversati sumus in desideriis carnis nostræ, facientes voluntatem carnis, et cogitationum, et eramus natura filii iræ, sicut et ceteri:

verses.textEn: Yet still, God, who is rich in mercy, for the sake of his exceedingly great charity with which he loved us,
verses.textLa: Deus autem, qui dives est in misericordia, propter nimiam charitatem suam, qua dilexit nos,

verses.textEn: even when we were dead in our sins, has enlivened us together in Christ, by whose grace you have been saved.
verses.textLa: et cum essemus mortui peccatis, convivificavit nos in Christo, (cuius gratia estis salvati)

verses.textEn: And he has raised us up together, and he has caused us to sit down together in the heavens, in Christ Jesus,
verses.textLa: et conresuscitavit, et consedere fecit in cælestibus in Christo Iesu:

verses.textEn: so that he may display, in the ages soon to arrive, the abundant wealth of his grace, by his goodness toward us in Christ Jesus.
verses.textLa: ut ostenderet in sæculis supervenientibus abundantes divitias gratiæ suæ in bonitate super nos in Christo Iesu.

verses.textEn: For by grace, you have been saved through faith. And this is not of yourselves, for it is a gift of God.
verses.textLa: Gratia enim estis salvati per fidem, et hoc non ex vobis: Dei enim donum est,

verses.textEn: And this is not of works, so that no one may glory.
verses.textLa: non ex operibus, ut nequis glorietur.

verses.textEn: For we are his handiwork, created in Christ Jesus for the good works which God has prepared and in which we should walk.
verses.textLa: Ipsius enim sumus factura, creati in Christo Iesu in operibus bonis, quæ præparavit Deus ut in illis ambulemus.

verses.textEn: Because of this, be mindful that, in times past, you were Gentiles in the flesh, and that you were called uncircumcised by those who are called circumcised in the flesh, something done by man,
verses.textLa: Propter quod memores estote, quod aliquando vos Gentes in carne, qui dicimini præputium ab ea, quæ dicitur circumcisio in carne, manu facta:
verses.notes: The implication of this last phrase is that circumcision itself is merely the work of human persons, by itself an external act and sign.

verses.textEn: and that you were, in that time, without Christ, being foreign to the way of life of Israel, being visitors to the testament, having no hope of the promise, and being without God in this world.
verses.textLa: quia eratis illo in tempore sine Christo, alienati a conversatione Israel, et hospites testamentorum, promissionis spem non habentes, et sine Deo in hoc mundo.

verses.textEn: But now, in Christ Jesus, you, who were in times past far away, have been brought near by the blood of Christ.
verses.textLa: Nunc autem in Christo Iesu vos, qui aliquando eratis longe, facti estis prope in sanguine Christi.

verses.textEn: For he is our peace. He made the two into one, by dissolving the intermediate wall of separation, of opposition, by his flesh,
verses.textLa: Ipse enim est pax nostra, qui fecit utraque unum, et medium parietem maceriæ solvens, inimicitias in carne sua:

verses.textEn: emptying the law of commandments by decree, so that he might join these two, in himself, into one new man, making peace
verses.textLa: legem mandatorum decretis evacuans, ut duos condat in semetipso in unum novum hominem, faciens pacem,

verses.textEn: and reconciling both to God, in one body, through the cross, destroying this opposition in himself.
verses.textLa: et reconciliet ambos in uno corpore, Deo per crucem, interficiens inimicitias in semetipso.

verses.textEn: And upon arriving, he evangelized peace to you who were far away, and peace to those who were near.
verses.textLa: Et veniens evangelizavit pacem vobis, qui longe fuistis, et pacem iis, qui prope.

verses.textEn: For by him, we both have access, in the one Spirit, to the Father.
verses.textLa: Quoniam per ipsum habemus accessum ambo in uno Spiritu ad Patrem.

verses.textEn: Now, therefore, you are no longer visitors and new arrivals. Instead, you are citizens among the saints in the household of God,
verses.textLa: Ergo iam non estis hospites, et advenæ: sed estis cives sanctorum, et domestici Dei:

verses.textEn: having been built upon the foundation of the Apostles and of the Prophets, with Jesus Christ himself as the preeminent cornerstone.
verses.textLa: superædificati super fundamentum Apostolorum, et Prophetarum, ipso summo angulari lapide Christo Iesu:

verses.textEn: In him, all that has been built is framed together, rising up into a holy temple in the Lord.
verses.textLa: in quo omnis ædificatio constructa crescit in templum sanctum in Domino,

verses.textEn: In him, you also have been built together into a habitation of God in the Spirit.
verses.textLa: in quo et vos coædificamini in habitaculum Dei in Spiritu.

verses.textEn: By reason of this grace, I, Paul, am a prisoner of Jesus Christ, for the sake of you Gentiles.
verses.textLa: Huius rei gratia, ego Paulus vinctus Christi Iesu, pro vobis Gentibus,

verses.textEn: Now certainly, you have heard of the dispensation of the grace of God, which has been given to me among you:
verses.textLa: si tamen audistis dispensationem gratiæ Dei, quæ data est mihi in vobis:

verses.textEn: that, by means of revelation, the mystery was made known to me, just as I have written above in a few words.
verses.textLa: quoniam secundum revelationem notum mihi factum est sacramentum, sicut supra scripsi in brevi:

verses.textEn: Yet, by reading this closely, you might be able to understand my prudence in the mystery of Christ.
verses.textLa: prout potestis legentes intelligere prudentiam meam in mysterio Christi:

verses.textEn: In other generations, this was unknown to the sons of men, even as it has now been revealed to his holy Apostles and Prophets in the Spirit,
verses.textLa: quod aliis generationibus non est agnitum filiis hominum, sicuti nunc revelatum est sanctis Apostolis eius, et Prophetis in Spiritu,

verses.textEn: so that the Gentiles would be co-heirs, and of the same body, and partners together, by his promise in Christ Jesus, through the Gospel.
verses.textLa: Gentes esse coheredes, et concorporales, et comparticipes promissionis eius in Christo Iesu per Evangelium:

verses.textEn: Of this Gospel, I have been made a minister, according to the gift of the grace of God, which has been given to me by means of the operation of his virtue.
verses.textLa: Cuius factus sum minister secundum donum gratiæ Dei, quæ data est mihi secundum operationem virtutis eius.

verses.textEn: Although I am the least of all the saints, I have been given this grace: to evangelize among the Gentiles the unsearchable riches of Christ,
verses.textLa: Mihi omnium sanctorum minimo data est gratia hæc, in Gentibus evangelizare investigabiles divitias Christi,

verses.textEn: and to enlighten everyone concerning the dispensation of the mystery, hidden before the ages in God who created all things,
verses.textLa: et illuminare omnes, quæ sit dispensatio sacramenti absconditi a sæculis in Deo, qui omnia creavit,

verses.textEn: so that the manifold wisdom of God may become well-known to the principalities and powers in the heavens, through the Church,
verses.textLa: ut innotescat principatibus, et potestatibus in cælestibus per Ecclesiam, multiformis sapientia Dei,

verses.textEn: according to that timeless purpose, which he has formed in Christ Jesus our Lord.
verses.textLa: secundum præfinitionem sæculorum, quam fecit in Christo Iesu Domino nostro:

verses.textEn: In him we trust, and so we approach with confidence, through his faith.
verses.textLa: In quo habemus fiduciam, et accessum in confidentia per fidem eius.

verses.textEn: Because of this, I ask you not to be weakened by my tribulations on your behalf; for this is your glory.
verses.textLa: Propter quod peto ne deficiatis in tribulationibus meis pro vobis: quæ est gloria vestra.

verses.textEn: By reason of this grace, I bend my knees to the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ,
verses.textLa: Huius rei gratia flecto genua mea ad Patrem Domini nostri Iesu Christi,

verses.textEn: from whom all paternity in heaven and on earth takes its name.
verses.textLa: ex quo omnis paternitas in cælis, et in terra nominatur,

verses.textEn: And I ask him to grant to you to be strengthened in virtue by his Spirit, in accord with the wealth of his glory, in the inner man,
verses.textLa: ut det vobis secundum divitias gloriæ suæ, virtute corroborari per Spiritum eius in interiorem hominem,
verses.notes: In this passage, Paul repeatedly uses the figure of the old or former man, meaning the sinful life that converts to Christianity have left behind, and the new or inner man in Christ, meaning the new life of imitation of Jesus Christ.

verses.textEn: so that Christ may live in your hearts through a faith rooted in, and founded on, charity.
verses.textLa: Christum habitare per fidem in cordibus vestris: in charitate radicati, et fundati,

verses.textEn: So may you be able to embrace, with all the saints, what is the width and length and height and depth
verses.textLa: ut possitis comprehendere cum omnibus sanctis, quæ sit latitudo, et longitudo, et sublimitas, et profundum:

verses.textEn: of the charity of Christ, and even be able to know that which surpasses all knowledge, so that you may be filled with all the fullness of God.
verses.textLa: scire etiam supereminentem scientiæ charitatem Christi, ut impleamini in omnem plenitudinem Dei.

verses.textEn: Now to him who is able to do all things, more abundantly than we could ever ask or understand, by means of the virtue which is at work in us:
verses.textLa: Ei autem, qui potens est omnia facere superabundanter quam petimus, aut intelligimus, secundum virtutem, quæ operatur in nobis:

verses.textEn: to him be glory, in the Church and in Christ Jesus, throughout every generation, forever and ever. Amen.
verses.textLa: Ipsi gloria in Ecclesia, et in Christo Iesu in omnes generationes sæculi sæculorum. Amen.

verses.textEn: And so, as a prisoner in the Lord, I beg you to walk in a manner worthy of the vocation to which you have been called:
verses.textLa: Obsecro itaque vos ego vinctus in Domino, ut digne ambuletis vocatione, qua vocati estis,

verses.textEn: with all humility and meekness, with patience, supporting one another in charity.
verses.textLa: cum omni humilitate, et mansuetudine, cum patientia, supportantes invicem in charitate,

verses.textEn: Be anxious to preserve the unity of the Spirit within the bonds of peace.
verses.textLa: soliciti servare unitatem Spiritus in vinculo pacis.

verses.textEn: One body and one Spirit: to this you have been called by the one hope of your calling:
verses.textLa: Unum corpus, et unus Spiritus, sicut vocati estis in una spe vocationis vestræ.

verses.textEn: one Lord, one faith, one baptism,
verses.textLa: Unus Dominus, una fides, unum baptisma.

verses.textEn: one God and Father of all, who is over all, and through all, and in us all.
verses.textLa: Unus Deus et Pater omnium, qui est super omnes, et per omnia, et in omnibus nobis.

verses.textEn: Yet to each one of us there has been given grace according to the measure allotted by Christ.
verses.textLa: Unicuique autem nostrum data est gratia secundum mensuram donationis Christi.

verses.textEn: Because of this, he says: “Ascending on high, he took captivity itself captive; he gave gifts to men.”
verses.textLa: Propter quod dicit: Ascendens in altum captivam duxit captivitatem: dedit dona hominibus.

verses.textEn: Now that he has ascended, what is left except for him also to descend, first to the lower parts of the earth?
verses.textLa: Quod autem ascendit, quid est, nisi quia et descendit primum in inferiores partes terræ?

verses.textEn: He who descended is the same one who also ascended above all the heavens, so that he might fulfill everything.
verses.textLa: Qui descendit, ipse est et qui ascendit super omnes cælos, ut impleret omnia.

verses.textEn: And the same one granted that some would be Apostles, and some Prophets, yet truly others evangelists, and others pastors and teachers,
verses.textLa: Et ipse dedit quosdam quidem Apostolos, quosdam autem Prophetas, alios vero Evangelistas, alios autem pastores, et doctores

verses.textEn: for the sake of the perfection of the saints, by the work of the ministry, in the edification of the body of Christ,
verses.textLa: ad consummationem sanctorum in opus ministerii, in ædificationem corporis Christi:

verses.textEn: until we all meet in the unity of faith and in the knowledge of the Son of God, as a perfect man, in the measure of the age of the fullness of Christ.
verses.textLa: donec occurramus omnes in unitatem fidei, et agnitionis Filii Dei, in virum perfectum, in mensuram ætatis plenitudinis Christi:

verses.textEn: So may we then no longer be little children, disturbed and carried about by every wind of doctrine, by the wickedness of men, and by the craftiness which deceives unto error.
verses.textLa: ut iam non simus parvuli fluctuantes, et circumferamur omni vento doctrinæ in nequitia hominum, in astutia ad circumventionem erroris.

verses.textEn: Instead, acting according to truth in charity, we should increase in everything, in him who is the head, Christ himself.
verses.textLa: Veritatem autem facientes in charitate, crescamus in illo per omnia, qui est caput Christus:

verses.textEn: For in him, the whole body is joined closely together, by every underlying joint, through the function allotted to each part, bringing improvement to the body, toward its edification in charity.
verses.textLa: ex quo totum corpus compactum, et connexum per omnem iuncturam subministrationis, secundum operationem in mensuram uniuscuiusque membri, augmentum corporis facit in ædificationem sui in charitate.

verses.textEn: And so, I say this, and I testify in the Lord: that from now on you should walk, not as the Gentiles also walk, in the vanity of their mind,
verses.textLa: Hoc igitur dico, et testificor in Domino, ut iam non ambuletis, sicut et Gentes ambulant in vanitate sensus sui,

verses.textEn: having their intellect obscured, being alienated from the life of God, through the ignorance that is within them, because of the blindness of their hearts.
verses.textLa: tenebris obscuratum habentes intellectum, alienati a vita Dei per ignorantiam, quæ est in illis, propter cæcitatem cordis ipsorum:

verses.textEn: Such as these, despairing, have given themselves over to sexual immorality, carrying out every impurity with rapacity.
verses.textLa: Qui desperantes, semetipsos tradiderunt impudicitiæ, in operationem immunditiæ omnis in avaritiam.
verses.notes: The word ‘impudicitiae’ can refer generally to severe sexual immorality, or it can refer more specifically to homosexuality. In passages such as this one, where it is the only word referring to sexual immorality, it is understood generally. But in passages where a series of specific sexual sins are named (adultery, fornication, etc.), this word is to be understood more specifically.

verses.textEn: But this is not what you have learned in Christ.
verses.textLa: Vos autem non ita didicistis Christum,

verses.textEn: For certainly, you have listened to him, and you have been instructed in him, according to the truth that is in Jesus:
verses.textLa: si tamen illum audistis, et in ipso edocti estis, sicut est veritas in Iesu.

verses.textEn: to set aside your earlier behavior, the former man, who was corrupted, by means of desire, unto error,
verses.textLa: Deponere vos secundum pristinam conversationem veterem hominem, qui corrumpitur secundum desideria erroris.

verses.textEn: and so be renewed in the spirit of your mind,
verses.textLa: Renovamini autem spiritu mentis vestræ,

verses.textEn: and so put on the new man, who, in accord with God, is created in justice and in the holiness of truth.
verses.textLa: et induite novum hominem, qui secundum Deum creatus est in iustitia, et sanctitate veritatis.

verses.textEn: Because of this, setting aside lying, speak the truth, each one with his neighbor. For we are all part of one another.
verses.textLa: Propter quod deponentes mendacium, loquimini veritatem unusquisque cum proximo suo: quoniam sumus invicem membra.

verses.textEn: “Be angry, but do not be willing to sin.” Do not let the sun set over your anger.
verses.textLa: Irascimini, et nolite peccare: sol non occidat super iracundiam vestram.
verses.notes: This first part is a quote from the Psalms.

verses.textEn: Provide no place for the devil.
verses.textLa: Nolite locum dare diabolo:

verses.textEn: Whoever was stealing, let him now not steal, but rather let him labor, working with his hands, doing what is good, so that he may have something to distribute to those who suffer need.
verses.textLa: qui furabatur, iam non furetur: magis autem laboret, operando manibus suis, quod bonum est, ut habeat unde tribuat necessitatem patienti.

verses.textEn: Let no evil words proceed from your mouth, but only what is good, toward the edification of faith, so as to bestow grace upon those who listen.
verses.textLa: Omnis sermo malus ex ore vestro non procedat: sed siquis bonus ad ædificationem fidei ut det gratiam audientibus.

verses.textEn: And do not be willing to grieve the Holy Spirit of God, in whom you have been sealed, unto the day of redemption.
verses.textLa: Et nolite contristare Spiritum Sanctum Dei: in quo signati estis in diem redemptionis.

verses.textEn: Let all bitterness and anger and indignation and outcry and blasphemy be taken away from you, along with all malice.
verses.textLa: Omnis amaritudo, et ira, et indignatio, et clamor, et blasphemia tollatur a vobis cum omni malitia.

verses.textEn: And be kind and merciful to one another, forgiving one another, just as God has forgiven you in Christ.
verses.textLa: Estote autem invicem benigni, misericordes, donantes invicem sicut et Deus in Christo donavit vobis.

verses.textEn: Therefore, as most beloved sons, be imitators of God.
verses.textLa: Estote ergo imitatores Dei, sicut filii charissimi:

verses.textEn: And walk in love, just as Christ also loved us and delivered himself for us, as an oblation and a sacrifice to God, with a fragrance of sweetness.
verses.textLa: et ambulate in dilectione, sicut et Christus dilexit nos, et tradidit semetipsum pro nobis oblationem, et hostiam Deo in odorem suavitatis.

verses.textEn: But let not any kind of fornication, or impurity, or rapacity so much as be named among you, just as is worthy of the saints,
verses.textLa: Fornicatio autem, et omnis immunditia, aut avaritia nec nominetur in vobis, sicut decet sanctos:

verses.textEn: nor any indecent, or foolish, or abusive talk, for this is without purpose; but instead, give thanks.
verses.textLa: aut turpitudo, aut stultiloquium, aut scurrilitas, quæ ad rem non pertinet: sed magis gratiarum actio.

verses.textEn: For know and understand this: no one who is a fornicator, or lustful, or rapacious (for these are a kind of service to idols) holds an inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and of God.
verses.textLa: Hoc enim scitote intelligentes: quod omnis fornicator, aut immundus, aut avarus, quod est idolorum servitus, non habet hereditatem in regno Christi, et Dei.

verses.textEn: Let no one seduce you with empty words. For because of these things, the wrath of God was sent upon the sons of unbelief.
verses.textLa: Nemo vos seducat inanibus verbis: propter hæc enim venit ira Dei in filios diffidentiæ.

verses.textEn: Therefore, do not choose to become participants with them.
verses.textLa: Nolite ergo effici participes eorum.

verses.textEn: For you were darkness, in times past, but now you are light, in the Lord. So then, walk as sons of the light.
verses.textLa: Eratis enim aliquando tenebræ: nunc autem lux in Domino. Ut filii lucis ambulate:

verses.textEn: For the fruit of the light is in all goodness and justice and truth,
verses.textLa: fructus enim lucis est in omni bonitate, et iustitia, et veritate:

verses.textEn: affirming what is well-pleasing to God.
verses.textLa: probantes quid sit beneplacitum Deo:

verses.textEn: And so, have no fellowship with the unfruitful works of darkness, but instead, refute them.
verses.textLa: et nolite communicare operibus infructuosis tenebrarum, magis autem redarguite.

verses.textEn: For the things that are done by them in secret are shameful, even to mention.
verses.textLa: Quæ enim in occulto fiunt ab ipsis, turpe est et dicere.

verses.textEn: But all things that are disputed are made manifest by the light. For all that is made manifest is light.
verses.textLa: Omnia autem, quæ arguuntur, a lumine manifestantur: omne enim, quod manifestatur, lumen est.

verses.textEn: Because of this, it is said: “You who are sleeping: awaken, and rise up from the dead, and so shall the Christ enlighten you.”
verses.textLa: Propter quod dicit: Surge qui dormis, et exsurge a mortuis, et illuminabit te Christus.

verses.textEn: And so, brothers, see to it that you walk cautiously, not like the foolish,
verses.textLa: Videte itaque fratres, quomodo caute ambuletis: non quasi insipientes,

verses.textEn: but like the wise: atoning for this age, because this is an evil time.
verses.textLa: sed ut sapientes: redimentes tempus, quoniam dies mali sunt.

verses.textEn: For this reason, do not choose to be imprudent. Instead, understand what is the will of God.
verses.textLa: Propterea nolite fieri imprudentes: sed intelligentes quæ sit voluntas Dei.

verses.textEn: And do not choose to be inebriated by wine, for this is self-indulgence. Instead, be filled with the Holy Spirit,
verses.textLa: Et nolite inebriari vino, in quo est luxuria: sed implemini Spiritu Sancto,

verses.textEn: speaking among yourselves in psalms and hymns and spiritual canticles, singing and reciting psalms to the Lord in your hearts,
verses.textLa: loquentes vobismetipsis in psalmis, et hymnis, et canticis spiritualibus, cantantes, et psallentes in cordibus vestris Domino,

verses.textEn: giving thanks always for everything, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, to God the Father.
verses.textLa: gratias agentes semper pro omnibus, in nomine Domini nostri Iesu Christi Deo et Patri.

verses.textEn: Be subject to one another in the fear of Christ.
verses.textLa: Subiecti invicem in timore Christi.

verses.textEn: Wives should be submissive to their husbands, as to the Lord.
verses.textLa: Mulieres viris suis subditæ sint, sicut Domino:

verses.textEn: For the husband is the head of the wife, just as Christ is the head of the Church. He is the Savior of his body.
verses.textLa: quoniam vir caput est mulieris: sicut Christus caput est Ecclesiæ: Ipse, salvator corporis eius.

verses.textEn: Therefore, just as the Church is subject to Christ, so also should wives be subject to their husbands in all things.
verses.textLa: Sed sicut Ecclesia subiecta est Christo, ita et mulieres viris suis in omnibus.

verses.textEn: Husbands, love your wives, just as Christ also loved the Church and handed himself over for her,
verses.textLa: Viri, diligite uxores vestras, sicut et Christus dilexit Ecclesiam, et seipsum tradidit pro ea,

verses.textEn: so that he might sanctify her, washing her clean by water and the Word of life,
verses.textLa: ut illam sanctificaret, mundans lavacro aquæ in Verbo vitæ,

verses.textEn: so that he might offer her to himself as a glorious Church, not having any spot or wrinkle or any such thing, so that she would be holy and immaculate.
verses.textLa: ut exhiberet ipse sibi gloriosam Ecclesiam, non habentem maculam, aut rugam, aut aliquid huiusmodi, sed ut sit sancta et immaculata.

verses.textEn: So, too, husbands should love their wives as their own bodies. He who loves his wife loves himself.
verses.textLa: Ita et viri debent diligere uxores suas ut corpora sua. Qui suam uxorem diligit, seipsum diligit.

verses.textEn: For no man has ever hated his own flesh, but instead he nourishes and cherishes it, as Christ also does to the Church.
verses.textLa: Nemo enim umquam carnem suam odio habuit: sed nutrit, et fovet eam, sicut et Christus Ecclesiam:

verses.textEn: For we are a part of his body, of his flesh and of his bones.
verses.textLa: quia membra sumus corporis eius, de carne eius, et de ossibus eius.

verses.textEn: “For this reason, a man shall leave behind his father and mother, and he shall cling to his wife; and the two shall be as one flesh.”
verses.textLa: Propter hoc relinquet homo patrem, et matrem suam, et adhærebit uxori suæ: et erunt duo in carne una.

verses.textEn: This is a great Sacrament. And I am speaking in Christ and in the Church.
verses.textLa: Sacramentum hoc magnum est; ego autem dico in Christo et in Ecclesia.

verses.textEn: Yet truly, each and every one of you should love his wife as himself. And a wife should fear her husband.
verses.textLa: Verumtamen et vos singuli, unusquisque uxorem suam sicut seipsum diligat: uxor autem timeat virum suum.

verses.textEn: Children, obey your parents in the Lord, for this is just.
verses.textLa: Filii, obedite parentibus vestris in Domino: hoc enim iustum est.

verses.textEn: Honor your father and your mother. This is the first commandment with a promise:
verses.textLa: Honora patrem tuum, et matrem tuam. Quod est mandatum primum in promissione:

verses.textEn: so that it may be well with you, and so that you may have a long life upon the earth.
verses.textLa: ut bene sit tibi, et sis longævus super terram.

verses.textEn: And you, fathers, do not provoke your children to anger, but educate them with the discipline and correction of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Et vos patres nolite ad iracundiam provocare filios vestros: sed educate illos in disciplina, et correptione Domini.

verses.textEn: Servants, be obedient to your lords according to the flesh, with fear and trembling, in the simplicity of your heart, as to Christ.
verses.textLa: Servi obedite dominis carnalibus cum timore, et tremore, in simplicitate cordis vestri, sicut Christo:

verses.textEn: Do not serve only when seen, as if to please men, but act as servants of Christ, doing the will of God from the heart.
verses.textLa: non ad oculum servientes, quasi hominibus placentes, sed ut servi Christi, facientes voluntatem Dei ex animo,

verses.textEn: Serve with good will, as to the Lord, and not to men.
verses.textLa: cum bona voluntate servientes, sicut Domino, et non hominibus:
verses.notes: The phrase ‘cum bona voluntate’ could also be rendered ‘with cheerfulness,’ or even as ‘willingly.’

verses.textEn: For you know that whatever good each one will do, the same will he receive from the Lord, whether he is servant or free.
verses.textLa: scientes quoniam unusquisque quodcumque fecerit bonum, hoc recipiet a Domino, sive servus, sive liber.

verses.textEn: And you, lords, act similarly toward them, setting aside threats, knowing that the Lord of both you and them is in heaven. For with him there is no favoritism toward anyone.
verses.textLa: Et vos domini eadem facite illis, remittentes minas: scientes quia et illorum, et vester Dominus est in cælis: et personarum acceptio non est apud eum.

verses.textEn: Concerning the rest, brothers, be strengthened in the Lord, by the power of his virtue.
verses.textLa: De cetero fratres confortamini in Domino, et in potentia virtutis eius.

verses.textEn: Be clothed in the armor of God, so that you may be able to stand against the treachery of the devil.
verses.textLa: Induite vos armaturam Dei, ut possitis stare adversus insidias diaboli.

verses.textEn: For our struggle is not against flesh and blood, but against principalities and powers, against the directors of this world of darkness, against the spirits of wickedness in high places.
verses.textLa: Quoniam non est nobis colluctatio adversus carnem et sanguinem: sed adversus principes, et potestates, adversus mundi rectores tenebrarum harum, contra spiritualia nequitiæ, in cælestibus.

verses.textEn: Because of this, take up the armor of God, so that you may be able to withstand the evil day and remain perfect in all things.
verses.textLa: Propterea accipite armaturam Dei, ut possitis resistere in die malo, et in omnibus perfeci stare.

verses.textEn: Therefore, stand firm, having been girded about your waist with truth, and having been clothed with the breastplate of justice,
verses.textLa: State ergo succincti lumbos vestros in veritate, et induti loricam iustitiæ,

verses.textEn: and having feet which have been shod by the preparation of the Gospel of peace.
verses.textLa: et calceati pedes in præparatione Evangelii pacis:

verses.textEn: In all things, take up the shield of faith, with which you may be able to extinguish all the fiery darts of the most wicked one.
verses.textLa: in omnibus sumentes scutum fidei, in quo possitis omnia tela nequissimi ignea extinguere:

verses.textEn: And take up the helmet of salvation and the sword of the Spirit (which is the Word of God).
verses.textLa: et galeam salutis assumite: et gladium spiritus (quod est verbum Dei)

verses.textEn: Through every kind of prayer and supplication, pray at all times in spirit, and so be vigilant with every kind of earnest supplication, for all the saints,
verses.textLa: per omnem orationem, et obsecrationem orantes omni tempore in spiritu: et in ipso vigilantes in omni instantia, et obsecratione pro omnibus sanctis:

verses.textEn: and also for me, so that words may be given to me, as I open my mouth with faith to make known the mystery of the Gospel,
verses.textLa: et pro me, ut detur mihi sermo in apertione oris mei cum fiducia, notum facere mysterium Evangelii:

verses.textEn: in such a manner that I may dare to speak exactly as I ought to speak. For I act as an ambassador in chains for the Gospel.
verses.textLa: pro quo legatione fungor in catena, ita ut in ipso audeam, prout oportet me, loqui.

verses.textEn: Now, so that you also may know the things that concern me and what I am doing, Tychicus, a most beloved brother and a faithful minister in the Lord, will make known everything to you.
verses.textLa: Ut autem et vos sciatis quæ circa me sunt, quid agam: omnia vobis nota faciet Tychicus, charissimus frater, et fidelis minister in Domino:

verses.textEn: I have sent him to you for this very reason, so that you may know the things that concern us, and so that he may console your hearts.
verses.textLa: quem misi ad vos in hoc ipsum, ut cognoscatis quæ circa nos sunt, et consoletur corda vestra.

verses.textEn: Peace to the brothers, and charity with faith, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.textLa: Pax fratribus, et charitas cum fide a Deo Patre, et Domino Iesu Christo.

verses.textEn: May grace be with all those who love our Lord Jesus Christ, unto incorruption. Amen.
verses.textLa: Gratia cum omnibus, qui diligunt Dominum nostrum Iesum Christum in incorruptione. Amen.
